result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J Wisialowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: To be paid on Extended Supervision through his other matter.

*If this sentence is served in the Jail after the prison sentence then the 1st 6 months jail are straight time and the last month with Huber.

AS OF 1/28/2015: Defendant is at Dodge Correctional. Court ordered Defendant to be eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs.
Consecutive to: current sentence currently serving

Dated 1/18/15 filed by the Defendant requesting the Court order he be eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Earned Release Program.
Request granted by Judge Aprahamian.  Amended JOC to be prepared.
Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: 12/18/14 sentencing.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Michael J Wisialowski in court, in custody, with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.   Penalty enhancer struck by Court upon motion of the State.  Court finds defendant guilty. 

Court orders the following:
Ct. 1:
- Seven (7) months jail consecutive to defendant's current sentence he is serving. (If this sentence is served in the jail after the prison sentence then the 1st 6 months jail are straight time and the last month is with Huber). 
- Court costs of $243.00 to be paid as condition of extended supervision on his other matter
- DNA Surcharge of $200.00 to be paid as a condition of extended supervision on his other matter
- State is not requesting restitution
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 18, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael J Wisialowski in court, in custody, with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
